data.text:
August

8 Thursday

Celebrate Recovery, 6:30 p.m. White Stone Church of the Nazarene, White Stone.

AA, 8 p.m. De Sales Hall, Kilmarnock.

Little Feet Community Playgroup, 9-11 a.m. White Stone Church of the Nazarene, 57 Whisk Drive, White Stone. 654-1497, sweetchaosfarm@gmail.com.

A Walk On The Wild Side, 9-11 a.m. Camp Store, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road, Lancaster. Theme: Nature Photo Walk – Tips and Tricks. $5 parking fee. Pre-registration requested, 462-5030.

$5 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $5.

Top Gun Sailing Camp, 9:30-11:30 a.m., 1-4 p.m. Christchurch School, 49 Seahorse Lane, Christchurch. For coaches, teams, individuals. High school/college-style fleet and team racing. Evening classroom sessions with breakout groups. Room and board available. Continues through August 12. For fees and program overviews: www.christchurchschool.org/summer-programs. Registration: rdeane@christchurchschool.org.

Grace Church Yard Sale, 10 a.m.-noon. Seventh Day Adventist Church Warehouse, 401 South Main Street, Kilmarnock.

Open Mic, 5-8 p.m. Northern Neck Brewing, 15804 Kings Highway, Montross. 493-3008.

Northumberland Supervisors, 5:30 p.m. Courts Building, 220 Judicial Place, Heathsville.

Darcy Dawn, 5:30-7 p.m. Main Stage, Richmond County Fair, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw.

Robbie Kerns, 6 p.m. Gloucester Brewing Company, 6778 Main Street, Gloucester.

Haus Band, 6-9 p.m. The 606, 606 Chesapeake Drive, White Stone.

Irvington Town Council, 6:30 p.m. Irvington Baptist Church, 53 King Carter Drive, Irvington. Joint public hearing with planning commission.

Richmond County Fair, 6-11 p.m. Richmond County Fairgrounds, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw. Admission: $4 per person, free younger than 3. Livestock, crops and craft exhibits; food and other vendors; carnival (wristbands $20-$30 in advance at colrides.com/events/18, or at the midway ticket booths, individual ride tickets $1.25 each, 24 for $25, 72 for $60); music nightly.

Trivia With Cole, 7 p.m. Callao Brewing Company, 129 Northumberland Highway, Callao. 529-1042.

Trivia Night, 7 p.m. Nacho Average Brew Pub, 44 West Church Street, Kilmarnock. 577-4011.

En’Novation Band, 7:30-10:30 p.m. Main Stage, Richmond County Fair, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw.

9 Friday

Lunch Bunch Al-Anon, noon. Grace Episcopal Church, Kilmarnock. For phone-in meetings, email fridaylunchbunchafg@gmail.com.

AA, noon. Trinity Episcopal, Lancaster.

Heritage Arts Class, 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Rice’s Hotel/Hughlett’s Tavern, 73 Monument Place, Heathsville. Instructor: Tavern Spinners & Weavers. Project: Beginning Weaving Workshop. Continues on August 10 and 11. $225. Equipment, supplies and materials provided. Register at www.RHHTFoundationInc.org, or 580-3377.

2024 Paddle By The Bay Pickleball Tournament, 9 a.m. Indian Creek Yacht and Country Club, 362 Club Drive, Kilmarnock, and Northern Neck Family YMCA, 39 William B. Graham Court, Kilmarnock. Sponsor: American Red Cross, Rappahannock Chapter. $75. Register at PickleballBrackets.com.

$5 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $5.

Rivah Quilters, 10 a.m. St. Andrews Presbyterian Church, 435 East Church Street, Kilmarnock. Speaker: Joyce Anderson. Trunk show: one block wonder quilts. Lunch will follow. Visitors and new members welcome.

Children’s Tours, 10:30 a.m.-noon. Steamboat Era Museum, 156 King Carter Drive, Irvington. $5 for children and one accompanying adult free. Register at steamboateramuseum.org or 438-6888.

Mahjong, 1 p.m. Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock.

Dance Class, 4-5 p.m. Good Luck Cellars, 1025 Goodluck Road, Kilmarnock. Instructor: Joy Hendershot. Line, circle and hip hop. Different move each session. No fee, no sign up. 435-1416.

Karleigh Gooding, 4-7 p.m. NN Burger, 303 Queen Street, Tappahannock.

Fire! 5-6 p.m., Campground Bath House, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road. $5 parking fee. 462-5030.

Hunter Owens, 5-7 p.m. Howard-Dooley Cafe, 9303 Buckley Hall Road, Mathews.

Black Cat Murphy, 5-9 p.m. Party on the Wharf, Williams Wharf, 1039 Williams Wharf Road, Mathews.

Faron Hamblin, 5:30 p.m. Northern Neck Brewing, 15804 Kings Highway, Montross. 493-3008.

Trent Jones, 5:30-7 p.m. Main Stage, Richmond County Fair, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw.

Open Mic/Bob Bell, 5:30-8:30 p.m. Jacey Vineyards, 619 Train Lane, Heathsville. 580-4053.

DJ Will, 5:30-7:30 p.m. Wine Down, Good Luck Cellars, 1025 Goodluck Road, Kilmarnock. 435-1416.

Tom Winecoff, 5:30-8:30 p.m. Generals Ridge Vineyard, 1618 Weldons Drive, Hague. 472-3172.

Erik Gaines, 6-8 p.m. Farmasea Restaurant, 6764 Main Street, Gloucester. 699-3659.

Jonathan Paige Brown Jr., 6-8 p.m. Fish Hawk, Tides Inn, 480 King Carter Drive, Irvington. 438-5000.

Richmond County Fair, 6-11 p.m. Richmond County Fairgrounds, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw. Admission: $4 per person, free younger than 3. Livestock, crops and craft exhibits; food and other vendors; carnival (wristbands $20-$30 in advance at colrides.com/events/18, or at the midway ticket booths, individual ride tickets $1.25 each, 24 for $25, 72 for $60); music nightly.

The Anvil Brothers, 6 p.m. Northern Neck BBQ at The Barn, 16829 Kings Highway, Montross.

Shane Cooley, 6-9 p.m. The Shack, Yankee Point Marina, 1303 Oak Hill Road, Lancaster.

S’more Campfire, 7-8 p.m. Amphitheater, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road. $5 parking fee. 462-5030.

Music Bingo, 7 p.m. Gloucester Brewing Company, 6778 Main Street, Gloucester.

Hard To Tell, 7 p.m. Callao Brewing Company, 129 Northumberland Highway, Callao. 529-1042.

Karaoke, 7-9 p.m. Nacho Average Brew Pub, 44 West Church Street, Kilmarnock. 577-4011.

Mike Reed, 7:30-10:30 p.m. Something Different, 213 Virginia Street, Urbanna. 758-8000.

Muddy Boots, 7:30-10:30 p.m. Main Stage, Richmond County Fair, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw.

“Run For Your Wife,” 7:30 p.m. Westmoreland Players Theatre, 16217 Richmond Road, Callao. $30 adults, $17 students. Purchase tickets at westmorelandplayers.org or call 529-9345.

DJ Big-E Diceman, 9 p.m.-2 a.m. Nooners, 15170 George Washington Memorial Highway, Saluda. 684-5726.

10 Saturday

AA, 7:30 p.m. Irvington Baptist.

AA, 8 p.m. Heathsville UMC.

Country Breakfast, 7-10 a.m. Lancaster Union Lodge #88, 48 North Main Street, Kilmarnock. $12, ages 6 and younger, eat free. All you can eat menu: scrambled eggs (fried eggs on request), pancakes (blueberry and plain), biscuits, sausage gravy, sausage links, bacon, cheesy grits, home fried potatoes, fried apples, warm syrup, fruit cocktail, coffee, tea, juice, milk. Orders to go also.

Warsaw Community Market, 8 a.m.-2 p.m. Warsaw Town Park, 171 Main Street, Warsaw. Produce, eggs, cheese, butter, sauces, canned goods, breads, baked goods, smoothies, plants, soaps, salves, candles, wreaths, floral creations, embroidery work, jewelry, clothing, handmade gifts.

Amish Market, 9 a.m.-3 p.m. 2248 Hampton Hall Road, Callao. Fresh produce, plants, baked goods.

Paint & Sip Party, 10 a.m.-noon. Morattico Waterfront Museum, 6584 Morattico Road, Morattico. Canvas, design and paints provided by Becky Jones. Subjects: crab, octopus, fish or pumpkins. Light refreshments. $30, cash or checks payable to Morattico Waterfront Museum. RESVP to MoratticoCurator@gmail.com by August 5.

$3 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $3.

Splash Of Summer, 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Town Centre Park, 150 North Main Street, Kilmarnock. Sponsor: Addy’s Colors. Games, activities, bounce house, comedy show, balloon twisting, food trucks, 50/50 raffle, glitter tattoos, special visits with Oyster Festival Queen and Little Miss Spat, Kayleigh Moye and Rosie Robertson.

Karleigh Gooding, noon-3 p.m. NN Burger, 303 Queen Street, Tappahannock.

Whoo’s For Dinner, 1-2 p.m. Visitor Center, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road. $5 parking fee, plus $2 per owl pellet. 462-5030.

Sally & Brian, 2:30-5:30 p.m. Generals Ridge Vineyard, 1618 Weldons Drive, Hague. 472-3172.

Make Your Own Nature Journal, 3:30-4:30 p.m. Camp Store, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road. $5 parking fee. 462-5030.

The GameChangers, 4-8 p.m. Second Saturdays, Tabor Park, 425 Bonner Street, Urbanna.

Second Saturday Social, 5-7 p.m. RAL Art Center, 19 North Main Street, Kilmarnock. Sponsors: Writers Guild of Virginia, RAL Art Center. Guest speaker: Cindy L. Freeman. Topic: memoir and generational writing, with insights and tips. Music by singer/guitarist Eric Eichenmuller. Books by Virginia authors. Light refreshments.

Chauncey Fortune, 5:30 p.m. Northern Neck Brewing, 15804 Kings Highway, Montross. 493-3008.

The Karen Jonas Band, 6-8 p.m. Music by the River, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road, Lancaster. $5 parking fee. Sponsor: Friends of Belle Isle. 462-5030.

Richmond County Fair, 6-11 p.m. Richmond County Fairgrounds, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw. Admission: $4 per person, free younger than 3. Livestock, crops and craft exhibits; food and other vendors; carnival (wristbands $20-$30 in advance at colrides.com/events/18, or at the midway ticket booths, individual ride tickets $1.25 each, 24 for $25, 72 for $60); music nightly.

Phil McKenny, 6-7 p.m. Main Stage, Richmond County Fair, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw.

Mercy Creek, 6-8 p.m. Fish Hawk, Tides Inn, 480 King Carter Drive, Irvington. 438-5000.

The Porchgliders, 6-9 p.m. Concerts by the Creek, Wendell G. Haynie Pavilion, Reedville Fishermen’s Museum, 504 Main Street, Reedville. $15. Purchase tickets at rfmuseum.org or the gate.

Deadrise, 6-9 p.m. The Beach, Yankee Point Marina, 1303 Oak Hill Road, Lancaster. Charity series.

Benefit Gospel Concert For Crystal Mann Bushong, 6:30-9 p.m. White Stone Church of the Nazarene, 57 Whisk Drive, White Stone. Love offering, silent auction, hot dogs/barbecue/snacks for purchase. Performers: Ralph Motley, Tommy Thompson, Heather MacKenzie, Sharon Webb Mann, Michele Thacker, Hunter Owens, Ronnie Vaught, Joe Magyar, Jim & Joelie Kepka, Lynda Smith Greve, Katrina, Smanth & Zach Ramaglino, Tabitha Toalson, Allaina Morelos, Richard Callis, Tres Barrineau, JA Faulkner, Jerry Ligon, and Tyrone Hudgins.

Last Fair Deal, 6:30-9:30 p.m. Flat Iron Crossroads, 7709 Flat Iron Road, Gloucester. $20. www. flatironcrossroads.com, 557-4888.

Karaoke-Breathe & Air Challenge, 7-11 p.m. Callao Brewing Company, 129 Northumberland Highway, Callao. 529-1042.

Billy Phillips, 7-10 p.m. Reedville Market, 729 Main Street, Reedville. 453-4666.

Open Mic 7-9 p.m. Nacho Average Brew Pub, 44 West Church Street, Kilmarnock. 577-4011.

“Run For Your Wife,” 7:30 p.m. Westmoreland Players Theatre, 16217 Richmond Road, Callao. $30 adults, $17 students. Purchase tickets at westmorelandplayers.org or call 529-9345.

Josh Grigsby & County Line Band, 7:30-10:30 p.m. Main Stage, Richmond County Fair, 315 Community Park Drive, Warsaw.

Rocket Band, 8 p.m.-midnight. Coles Point Tavern, 850 Salisbury Park Road, Hague.

The Shooters Band, 8 p.m.-midnight. Nooners, 15170 George Washington Memorial Highway, Saluda. 684-5726.

11 Sunday

Operatic Soprano Esther Heideman, 11 a.m. Kilmarnock United Methodist Church, 89 East Church Street, Kilmarnock.

Dreamer’s Market, 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Arts Center of Montross, 14961 Kings Highway, Montross. Entrepreneurs ages 8-18 showcase and sell their handcrafted goods. 703-887-2878.

Sangria Sunday, noon-5 p.m. Good Luck Cellars, 1025 Goodluck Road, Kilmarnock. 435-1416.

Peyton Brabrand Jazz Brunch, noon-3 p.m. Meridian Restaurant, Compass Entertainment Complex, 100 Entertainment Drive, Irvington. 884-4386.

Grace Church Yard Sale, 1-3 p.m. Seventh Day Adventist Church Warehouse, 401 South Main Street, Kilmarnock.

Moonshine Society Duo, 1-5 p.m. Ingleside Vineyards, 5872 Leedstown Road, Oak Grove.

Cameron Ashton, 2 p.m. Northern Neck Brewing, 15804 Kings Highway, Montross. 493-3008.

Don DeWolf, 2 p.m. Willaby’s Beach, 327 Old Ferry Road, White Stone.

“Run For Your Wife,” 3 p.m. Westmoreland Players Theatre, 16217 Richmond Road, Callao. $30 adults, $17 students. Purchase tickets at westmorelandplayers.org or call 529-9345.

12 Monday

AA, noon, De Sales Hall, Kilmarnock.

AA, 8 p.m. Wicomico Methodist Church, Wicomico Church.

One-On-One With Connie Canby, The Arts Center Of Montross, 14961 Kings Highway, Montross. Art instruction and critique. 703-887-2878.

$3 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $3.

Babygarten, 10:30 a.m. Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Classes are held next door at Town Centre Park, 150 North Main Street, Kilmarnock.

Mahjong, 1-4 p.m. Woman’s Club of White Stone, 560 Chesapeake Drive, White Stone. Text 436-7144 to reserve a table.

Computer Class, 3-5 p.m. Northumberland Public Library, 7204 Northumberland Highway, Heathsville. Bring a laptop, iPad or phone or use a library laptop. 580-5051.

LCL In Stitches, 5 p.m. Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Knitting, crocheting.

Northumberland Supervisors, 5 p.m. Courts Building, 220 Judicial Place, Heathsville.

Mike Reed, 5:30-7:30 p.m. Hole in the Wall Waterfront Grill, 384 Old Ferry Road, Gwynns Island. 505-1005.

Lancaster School Board, 5:30 p.m. Haydon Building, Dream Fields, 1385 Irvington Road, Kilmarnock.

Northumberland School Board, 6 p.m. Northumberland High School, 201 Academic Lane, Claraville.

Information Intoxication Trivia, 7-9 p.m. Gloucester Brewing Company, 6778 Main Street, Gloucester.

Kilmarnock Planning Commission, 7 p.m. Town Hall, 1 North Main Street, Kilmarnock.

13 Tuesday

AA, 7 p.m., De Sales Hall, Kilmarnock. Beginners and young people welcome.

Fishing Camp, 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Capt. Chris D. Dollar, Chesapeake Fishing Camps on Carter Creek and the Rappahannock River. Rising fifth-eighth graders. $295, includes t-shirt and Lure Kit. Continues on August 14. For a registration form, email cdollarchesapeake@gmail.com or call 410-991-8468.

Grace Church Yard Sale, 10 a.m.-noon. Seventh Day Adventist Church Warehouse, 401 South Main Street, Kilmarnock.

Storytime, 10 a.m. Northumberland Public Library, 7204 Northumberland Highway, Heathsville.

$3 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $3.

Northern Neck Duplicate Bridge, 1 p.m. Grace Episcopal Church, 303 South Main Street, Kilmarnock.

14 Wednesday

AA, noon. Women’s meeting, Irvington UMC.

Serenity Al-Anon, 5:30 p.m., Trinity Episcopal Church, Lancaster.

AA 12 & 12 Study Group, 7 p.m., Shachah World Ministries, Kilmarnock.

Storytime, 10 a.m. Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Classes are held next door at Town Centre Park, 150 North Main Street, Kilmarnock.

$3 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $3.

Rappahannock Amateur Radio Association, 11:30 a.m.. Lee’s Restaurant, 30 South Main Street, Kilmarnock.

Summer Jam 2024 Advocacy Challenge, 4-5:30 p.m. Boys & Girls Club of the Northern Neck, 517 North Main Street, Kilmarnock. Open to all teens. Rep. Rob Wittman will attend. Ice cream social to follow.

Open Mic/Slow Burn Duo, 5:30-8:30 p.m. Something Different, 213 Virginia Street, Urbanna. 758-8000.

Mackenzie Roark, 6-8 p.m. Fish Hawk, Tides Inn, 480 King Carter Drive, Irvington. 438-5000.

Open Mic, 6:30-9:30 p.m. That Damn Mary Brewing Company, 5036 George Washington Memorial Highway, Hayes. 210-1383.

15 Thursday

Celebrate Recovery, 6:30 p.m. White Stone Church of the Nazarene, White Stone.

AA, 8 p.m. De Sales Hall, Kilmarnock.

Little Feet Community Playgroup, 9-11 a.m. White Stone Church of the Nazarene, 57 Whisk Drive, White Stone. 654-1497, sweetchaosfarm@gmail.com.

A Walk On The Wild Side, 9-11 a.m. Camp Store, Belle Isle State Park, 1632 Belle Isle Road, Lancaster. Theme: Nature Photo Walk – Tips and Tricks. $5 parking fee. Pre-registration requested, 462-5030.

$3 Bag Sale, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Dee’s Attic Bookstore, Lancaster Community Library, 16 Town Centre Drive, Kilmarnock. Gently used books, puzzles, DVDs, CDs, LPs, audio books. Fill up a bag for $3.

Art Workshop: Mixology of Glorious Greens, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. RAL Art Center, 19 North Main Street, Kilmarnock. Instructor: Cate Kauffman. $90 members, $105 others. For materials list and registration, visit RAL Art Center, ralartcenter.com, or call 436-9309.

Grace Church Yard Sale, 10 a.m.-noon. Seventh Day Adventist Church Warehouse, 401 South Main Street, Kilmarnock.

VAHS Luncheon, 11:30 a.m. Pilot House Restaurant, 2737 Greys Point Road, Topping. Social time, lunch and program.

Coffee-time Sip & Paint, 1-3:30 p.m. Rice’s Hotel/Hughlett’s Tavern, 73 Monument Place, Heathsville. Project: The Kingdom of the Seashell. The fee is $35, plus a $5 material fee. Register at www.RHHTFoundationInc.org, or 580-3377.

The First Three: From Washington to Jefferson, 5 p.m. reception, 6 p.m. presentation. Summer Speaker Series, Historic Christ Church & Museum, 420 Christ Church Road, Weems. Speaker: Susan Kern. Topic: “The Jeffersons at Shadwell.” $25, or season subscription. For tickets, visit ChristChurch1735.org.

Open Mic, 5-8 p.m. Northern Neck Brewing, 15804 Kings Highway, Montross. 493-3008.

Erik Gaines, 6 p.m. Gloucester Brewing Company, 6778 Main Street, Gloucester.

Haus Band, 6-9 p.m. The 606, 606 Chesapeake Drive, White Stone.

Karaoke, 7-10 p.m. Little Jimmy’s, 240 Virginia Street, Urbanna. 286-9005.

Trivia With Cole, 7 p.m. Callao Brewing Company, 129 Northumberland Highway, Callao. 529-1042.

Trivia Night, 7 p.m. Nacho Average Brew Pub, 44 West Church Street, Kilmarnock. 577-4011.

Lancaster Planning Commission, 6 p.m. Administration Building, 8311 Mary Ball Road, Lancaster.
